org.bicycleGeometryWorkshop.ui.measure

Class Measure

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bicycleGeometryWorkshop.ui.measure.Measure
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MeasureAngle, MeasureDistance

    public abstract class Measure
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for on-screen measuring utilities.

    • Method Detail

      • resetMeasure

        public final void resetMeasure()
        Initialize the measuring object or reset it after previous use. This is called when set active. Any sub class should rely on reset() to individual reset operations.

      • reset

        protected abstract void reset()
        Do any internal reset or preparations here. This will be called by resetMeasure() when activated.

      • updateTransform

        public void updateTransform(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform transform)
        Update the World to Screen Transform from the current Graphics object transform.
        Parameters:
        transform - The current graphics object transform.

      • pointClicked

        public final void pointClicked(java.awt.geom.Point2D point)
        Call method for when a Point is clicked.
        Parameters:
        point - The point clicked in screen coordinates.

      • onPointClicked

        public abstract void onPointClicked(java.awt.geom.Point2D worldPoint)
        Called from point clicked event.
        Parameters:
        worldPoint - The point in World Coordinates.

      • dynamicPoint

        public final void dynamicPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D point)

      • onDynamicPoint

        public abstract void onDynamicPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D worldPoint)
        Method to update measure with the current dynamic point (i.e.: mouse point on MouseMove)
        Parameters:
        worldPoint - Current dynamic point (or mouse point) in world coordinates.

      • renderInWorld

        public abstract void renderInWorld(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                                   float scale)
        Render any Graphics that need to be painted in world space.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The graphics object to paint to.
        scale - The scale of the current transform for line weights, etc.

      • renderInScreen

        public abstract void renderInScreen(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        Render screen message.
        Parameters:
        g2 - Th graphics object to render to.

      • resetScreenLayout

        public final void resetScreenLayout()
        Resets the screen layout line counter. Call this at the beginning of each screen draw session to reset the line counter.

      • renderScreenLine

        public final void renderScreenLine(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                                   java.lang.String text,
                                   java.awt.Color color)
        Render a Line of text to the screen. Subsequent calls will layout below each preceeding line.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The graphics object to draw to.
        text - The text to display.
        color - The color to use for the line.

      • renderScreenLine

        public final void renderScreenLine(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                                   java.lang.String text)
        Render a Line of text to the screen. Subsequent calls will layout below each preceeding line. Uses default text color.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The graphics object to draw to.
        text - The text to display.

      • renderCrossHandle

        public void renderCrossHandle(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                              java.awt.geom.Point2D point,
                              float scale)
        render a cross shaped handle.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The graphics object to render to.
        point - Location of the handle.
        scale - Scale for line weight, etc.

      • renderDotHandle

        public void renderDotHandle(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                            java.awt.geom.Point2D point,
                            float scale)
        Render a Dot Handle - center point for arcs, etc. This renders an open circle.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The graphics object to render to.
        point - Location of the handle.
        scale - Scale for line weight, etc.

      • renderLine

        public void renderLine(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                       java.awt.geom.Point2D startPoint,
                       java.awt.geom.Point2D endPoint,
                       float scale,
                       java.awt.Color color,
                       boolean dashed)
        Render a Line.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The graphics object to paint to.
        startPoint - Start point of the line.
        endPoint - End point of the line.
        scale - Scale for line weight,etc.
        color - Color of the line to draw.
        dashed - True to show dashed, false to draw solid line.

      • renderArc

        public void renderArc(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D basePoint,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D pointA,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D pointB,
                      float scale)
        Render an arc. This will render an arc for the smallest angle of the given points.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The graphics object to paint to.
        basePoint - Base point or center of arc.
        pointA - Point to define an angle.
        pointB - Point to define an angle.
        scale - Scale for line weight,etc.
